alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 1:13PM CDT until July 20 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, McMinn and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 212 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is either ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch to 1.0 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in more minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Athens, Sweetwater, Madisonville, Englewood, Vonore, Tellico Plains, Niota, Tariffville, Mount Vernon, McGee Carson Peninsula, Citico and Citico Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
